intro: Epilobium thermophilum, commonly known as the warm-loving willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Epilobium thermophilum thrives in sunny, well-drained soils, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It is typically found in temperate regions and is considered a short-lived perennial.
